abstract: The head of HSBC‘s Asian business, Michael Smith, unexpectedly resigned to become chief executive of the Australia and New Zealand Banking Group, signaling that ANZ will continue an aggressive expansion into Asia. Mr. Smith, 50, who worked for HSBC for 29 years, succeeds John McFarlane, who ran the bank for a decade.
lead_paragraph: The head of HSBC‘s Asian business, Michael Smith, unexpectedly resigned to become chief executive of the Australia and New Zealand Banking Group, signaling that ANZ will continue an aggressive expansion into Asia. Mr. Smith, 50, who worked for HSBC for 29 years, succeeds John McFarlane, who ran the bank for a decade.

headline.main: HSBC Executive to Take Top Post at ANZ
